poem:
"Echoes of Power"

Words of metal clang in the marketplace,
Hymns to ambition, fervent, singing fire.
In silent corners, echoes grimace,
Mirthlessly mirroring this political dire.
Far-right, like hawks, enhanced,
Their talons clench on Europe's soul.
The silent stars in pity glance,
As darkness stretches its unholy toll. 
Yet, in the morning's quiet light,
Silently the gentle sun dispels the night.
